Package com.intellij.openapi.vcs

Class AbstractVcs

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.vcs.StartedActivated
      • com.intellij.openapi.vcs.AbstractVcs
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CvsVcs2, GitVcs, HgVcs, MockAbstractVcs, SvnVcs

    public abstract class AbstractVcs
extends StartedActivated
    The base class for a version control system integrated with IDEA.
    See Also:
    ProjectLevelVcsManager

        See Also:
        getShortName()

      • getShortName

        public java.lang.String getShortName()
        Returns the short or abbreviated name of this VCS, which name can be used in those places in the UI where the space is limited. (e.g. it can be "SVN" for Subversion or "Hg" for Mercurial).

        By default returns the same as getDisplayName().

      • fileIsUnderVcs

        @Deprecated
public boolean fileIsUnderVcs(FilePath filePath)
        Deprecated. Use VcsRootChecker instead.
        Returns true if the specified file path is located under a directory which is managed by this VCS. This method is called only for directories which are mapped to this VCS in the project configuration.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to check.
        Returns:
        true if the path is managed by this VCS, false otherwise.

      • fileExistsInVcs

        public boolean fileExistsInVcs(FilePath path)
        Returns true if the specified file path represents a file which exists in the VCS repository (is neither unversioned nor scheduled for addition). This method is called only for directories which are mapped to this VCS in the project configuration.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to check.
        Returns:
        true if the corresponding file exists in the repository, false otherwise.

      • enableIntegration

        public void enableIntegration()
        This method is called when user invokes "Enable VCS Integration" and selects a particular VCS. By default it sets up a single mapping <Project> -> selected VCS.

      • mayRemoveChangeList

        public ThreeState mayRemoveChangeList(LocalChangeList list,
                                      boolean explicitly)
        Invoked when a changelist is deleted explicitly by user or implicitly (e.g. after default changelist switch when the previous one was empty).
        Parameters:
        list - change list that's about to be removed
        explicitly - whether it's a result of explicit Delete action, or just after switching the active changelist.
        Returns:
        UNSURE if the VCS has nothing to say about this changelist. YES or NO if the changelist has to be removed or not, and no further confirmations are needed about this changelist (in particular, the VCS can show a confirmation to the user by itself)

        public UpdateEnvironment getStatusEnvironment()
        Returns the interface for performing "check status" operations (operations which show the differences between the local working copy state and the latest server state).
        Returns:
        the status interface, or null if the check status operation is not supported or required by the VCS.

      • parseRevisionNumber

        public VcsRevisionNumber parseRevisionNumber(java.lang.String revisionNumberString,
                                             FilePath path)
                                      throws VcsException
        For some version controls (like Git) the revision parsing is dependent on the the specific repository instance since the the revision number returned from this method is later used for comparison information. By default, this method invokes parseRevisionNumber(String). The client code should invoke this method, if it expect ordering information from revision numbers.
        Parameters:
        revisionNumberString - the string to be parsed
        path - the path for which revision number is queried
        Returns:
        the parsed revision number
        Throws:
        VcsException

      • parseRevisionNumber

        public VcsRevisionNumber parseRevisionNumber(java.lang.String revisionNumberString)
                                      throws VcsException
        Throws:
        VcsException

      • getRevisionPattern

        public java.lang.String getRevisionPattern()
        Returns:
        null if does not support revision parsing

      • isVersionedDirectory

        @Deprecated
public boolean isVersionedDirectory(VirtualFile dir)
        Deprecated. Use VcsRootChecker instead.
        Checks if the specified directory is managed by this version control system (regardless of the project VCS configuration). For example, for CVS this checks the presense of "CVS" admin directories. This method is used for VCS autodetection during initial project creation and VCS configuration.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to check.
        Returns:
        true if directory is managed by this VCS

      • getRootConfigurable

        public UnnamedConfigurable getRootConfigurable(VcsDirectoryMapping mapping)
        Returns the configurable to be shown in the VCS directory mapping dialog which should be displayed for configuring VCS-specific settings for the specified root, or null if no such configuration is required. The VCS-specific settings are stored in VcsDirectoryMapping.getRootSettings().
        Parameters:
        mapping - the mapping being configured
        Returns:
        the configurable instance, or null if no configuration is required.

      • createEmptyVcsRootSettings

        public VcsRootSettings createEmptyVcsRootSettings()

      • getCustomConvertor

        public AbstractVcs.RootsConvertor getCustomConvertor()

      • needsLegacyDefaultMappings

        public boolean needsLegacyDefaultMappings()
        This switch disables platform support for "default mapping" aka "<Project>".

        If enabled, platform will do nothing. All roots from DefaultVcsRootPolicy will be registered as vcs root. Vcs can try using AbstractVcs.RootsConvertor to process roots itself.

        If disabled, platform will use VcsRootChecker or VcsEP.administrativeAreaName to find actual vcs roots. If vcs does not implement these EP, no vcs roots will be registered for "default mapping".

        See Also:
        ProjectLevelVcsManager, NewMappings

      • getMergeProvider

        public MergeProvider getMergeProvider()
        Returns the implementation of the merge provider which is used to load the revisions to be merged for a particular file.
        Returns:
        the merge provider implementation, or null if the VCS doesn't support merge operations.
